dialogue: what is this?
It’s clear…
But I haven't read the file yet.
Whether you read it or not, you must write the sentence and sign it. It’s the prosecutor's order.
I can't do that; I swore for justice!
I recommend you read the judges’ oath once more.
Cigarette?
Do you think you became an investigating judge overnight?
The boss doesn't like you. He was against your transfer here right from the beginning. He wanted to bring his person. I insisted. And now he’s waiting for the tiniest mistake on your part.

Are you trying to undermine me? Or do you want to turn your back on your own progress and success, your wife and children? Do you know how many people were trying to be an investigating judge in this office? How many years you’ve been waiting to be a judge? Iman, here you have to fight. You have to prove yourself,
especially in this case which is a direct order from the prosecutor.
But I haven't even read the case, how can I issue a punishment for "waging war against God”? and request a death penalty?
Prosecutor's order... is the law, do you understand?
Six months to three years of prison!

Now, the prison sentence aside, the main issue is your professional credibility. It hasn’t even been two weeks since you came here. It’s a disgrace! All the gossip! They’ll say he couldn’t manage to keep a gun for two weeks.
Your competence will be questioned. They’ll become skeptical about you and get in the way of your promotion.
I will find it no matter what.
For now, neither report it nor talk about it with anyone.
Based on what you say, I have no doubt that the gun is still in the house. Maybe if you don't do anything for a few days, the one who took it brings it back.
No, no, Najmeh, I am sure that it’s at home, probably Rezvan took it. Think of what she was saying last night.
Your mistake was telling your wife and children what your job is.
Is it possible not to?
Yes, it is.
For how long?
Till you’re in the grave!
I’m stuck, I don’t know what to do.
It's only natural. They don’t teach us in any university or classroom how an investigating judge should interrogate his wife and children!
I’m confused.
Which one do you suspect the most?
I can't believe that my children did this.
Do you think it’s your wife?
No, I trust her completely.
Really?
Right now, I’m suspicious about everyone and everything.
How can you live with doubts? Being afraid in your own house? There is a way that makes it easier. At least you understand how much you can trust your wife and children...
what way?
Alireza, take them to Alireza.
Alireza?
Yes, he studied for this. You know that in interrogation he is the best. He can use psychological interrogation techniques and tell you for certain who did it.

How though? Alireza is my friend, he has been to our home many times. We’ve been to their place. His wife is friends with my wife. His children are friends with my children. How can I ask him to interrogate them now?

What is an interrogation? He asks a few questions, using psychological techniques and studying their body language, and then he tells you who has the gun! What’s wrong with that? Do you want everyone to find out what happened to the gun first? End this story quietly.
I can't take them to Alireza.
Do you have a safer person? Do you know a better way?
Someone is behind this story. Someone wants to get rid of me.
I told you to be careful.
It's time to report the missing gun.
Take this situation seriously. Write a letter to the head of the prosecutor's office right now. explain that your private

information has been leaked in cyberspace, and you are in danger. Request an institutional home with high-level security in a safe area. Take this letter to the president's office, register it, and go back home quickly. Take your wife and children and go to a safe place for a few days until things clear out.
I have two, this one can stay with you for now.
What are you waiting for?

the apartment. Living room. Without paying attention to anything, Iman enters the apartment and goes to the bedroom. Najmeh is in the kitchen. She is surprised by Iman's behavior. Najmeh's bedroom. Iman observes the motorcyclist from the bedroom’s window. The motorcyclist gets out of his sight. Iman starts to change his clothes but suddenly the doorbell rings. Iman rushes out of the room and toward the doorbell camera. Living room. Surprised, Najmeh stops working and looks at him. Iman answers the door.
Yes, yes ...
who is it?
